intro: Haplopappus carthamoides, commonly known as the common pappus, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers consist of yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale green to white ray flowers. Haplopappus carthamoides is often used in ecological restoration due to its hardy nature and ability to stabilize soil.
